page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: Walton is set in an area of pastoral farming which is mainly set aside for DAIRY FARMING. The western end of the survey area is particularly rural and includes several dairy farms. An interesting feature of the western edge of the block is that of the land which belongs to the experimental farm located in the adjacent 12 km. block. A variety of unusual breeds can be seen in the fields. Much of the survey area is a mixture of light industry, housing, and land given over to farming. Three major features that are found in the area are; the M.6. motorway, the River Trent, and the Trent and Mersey Canal. The latter feature once had the company H.Q. based in nearby Stone. There three centres of population, the village of Aston, Little Stoke and the housing estate of Walton.
